name: unsaleable
content:
unsaleable adjective
(SELLING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not easy to sell or not suitable for selling: The warehouses were full of unsaleable stock. In areas where flood risk was high, homes became virtually unsaleable. Opposite
saleableSynonym
unsellable (SELLING)Related word
sell
More examplesFewer examplesMost of the photographs he receives at the auction house are of unsaleable objects.He threw the plate away because it was totally unsaleable.She said that poor planning decisions would make more homes unsaleable and uninsurable.In its present condition, the car is unsaleable.

Advertising and marketing
unsaleable adjective
(PERSUADING)
If an idea or plan is unsaleable, it is not possible to persuade people that it is good and likely to be successful: His message may be unsaleable, but he will not be deterred. It seems you consider her ideas to be correct but unsaleable. Synonym
unsellable (PERSUADE)
